edu.ucsb.cs56.S13.Blackjack

Class Blackjack

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.S13.Blackjack.Blackjack

  • public class Blackjack
extends java.lang.Object
    Blackjack Class has the following: Deck, ArrayList (list for players), Player (dealer), and Card (next card to show). This class also contains methods for hitting and staying.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Blackjack()
      constructor
      Blackjack(Hand dh, Hand p1, Hand p2, Hand p3)
      4 arg constructor for testing purposes

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int dealerHandValue()
      returns the value of the dealer's hand with aces valued at 1
      boolean dealerHasBlackjack()
      returns true if dealer has blackjack
      Card dealerHit()
      makes the dealer hit and returns a reference to the card he drew so it can be displayed
      boolean dealerNotBust()
      returns false if the dealer busted
      int dealerSecondValue()
      returns the value of the dealer's hand with aces valued at 11 or returns -1 if the value of the dealer's hand with aces valued at 11 makes the value greater than 21
      boolean dealerShouldStay()
      decides whether or not the dealer should stay i.e.
      java.lang.String displayDealerCardValue()
      formats a String to return the value of just the dealer's first card during the player's turn
      char evaluateWinner(Player player)
      evaluates the winner of the game
      Player getDealer()
      returns reference to dealer Player
      Card getDealerCard()
      returns a reference to the Card that the dealer is showing
      Hand getDealerHand()
      returns a reference to the dealer's hand
      Player getPlayer(int index)
      returns reference to Player within players ArrayList according to index
      Player getPlayerE()
      returns reference to Player in East
      Player getPlayerS()
      returns reference to Player in South
      Player getPlayerW()
      returns reference to Player in West
      void newRound()
      initializes a new round by dealing new hands to every player
      boolean playerHasBlackjack(Player player)
      returns true if player passed to method has blackjack
      Card playerHit(Player player)
      makes the player passed as a parameter hit and returns a reference to the card drawn so it can be displayed
